fr.zelus.jarvis.core

Class JarvisModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zelus.jarvis.core.JarvisModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoreModule, DiscordModule, GenericChatModule, GithubModule, LogModule, SlackModule

    public abstract class JarvisModule
extends Object
    The concrete implementation of a Module definition.

    A JarvisModule manages a set of JarvisActions that represent the concrete actions that can be executed by the module. This class provides primitives to enable/disable specific actions, and construct JarvisAction instances from a given EventInstance.

    Note that enabling a JarvisAction will load the corresponding class, that must be stored in the action package of the concrete JarvisModule implementation. For example, enabling the action MyAction from the JarvisModule myModulePackage.MyModule will attempt to load the class myModulePackage.action.MyAction.

    • Field Detail

      • jarvisCore

        protected JarvisCore jarvisCore
        The JarvisCore instance containing this module.

      • configuration

        protected Configuration configuration
        The Configuration used to initialize this class.

        This Configuration is used by the JarvisModule to initialize the EventProviders and JarvisActions.

        See Also:
        startEventProvider(EventProviderDefinition), createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession)

      • actionMap

        protected Map<String,Class<? extends JarvisAction>> actionMap
        The Map containing the JarvisAction associated to this module.

        This Map is used as a cache to retrieve JarvisAction that have been previously loaded.

        See Also:
        enableAction(Action), disableAction(Action), createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession)

      • eventProviderMap

        protected Map<String,JarvisModule.EventProviderThread> eventProviderMap
        The Map containing the JarvisModule.EventProviderThreads associated to this module.

        This Map filled when new EventProviders are started (see startEventProvider(EventProviderDefinition)), and is used to cache JarvisModule.EventProviderThreads and stop them when the module is shutdown().

        See Also:
        shutdown()

    • Constructor Detail

      • JarvisModule

        public JarvisModule(JarvisCore jarvisCore,
                    Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new JarvisModule from the provided JarvisCore and Configuration.

        Note: this constructor will be called by jarvis internal engine when initializing the JarvisModules. Subclasses implementing this constructor typically need additional parameters to be initialized, that can be provided in the configuration.

        Parameters:
        jarvisCore - the JarvisCore instance associated to this module
        configuration - the Configuration used to initialize the JarvisModule
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided jarvisCore or configuration is null
        See Also:
        JarvisModule(JarvisCore)

      • JarvisModule

        public JarvisModule(JarvisCore jarvisCore)
        Constructs a new JarvisModule from the provided JarvisCore.

        Note: this constructor should be used by JarvisModules that do not require additional parameters to be initialized. In that case see JarvisModule(JarvisCore, Configuration).

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided jarvisCore is null
        See Also:
        JarvisModule(JarvisCore, Configuration)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Returns the name of the module.

        This method returns the value of Class.getSimpleName(), and can not be overridden by concrete subclasses. JarvisModule's names are part of jarvis' naming convention, and are used to dynamically load modules and actions.

        Returns:
        the name of the module.

      • getJarvisCore

        public final JarvisCore getJarvisCore()
        Returns the JarvisCore instance associated to this module.
        Returns:
        the JarvisCore instance associated to this module

      • startEventProvider

        public final void startEventProvider(EventProviderDefinition eventProviderDefinition)
        Starts the EventProvider corresponding to the provided eventProviderDefinition.

        This method dynamically loads the EventProvider corresponding to the provided eventProviderDefinition, and starts it in a dedicated Thread.

        This method also registers WebhookEventProviders to the underlying JarvisServer (see JarvisServer.registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider)).

        Parameters:
        eventProviderDefinition - the EventProviderDefinition representing the EventProvider to start
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided eventProviderDefinition or jarvisCore is null
        See Also:
        Runnable.run(), JarvisServer.registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider)

      • getEventProviderMap

        protected Map<String,JarvisModule.EventProviderThread> getEventProviderMap()
        Returns Map containing the JarvisModule.EventProviderThreads associated to this module. Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.
        Returns:
        the Map containing the JarvisModule.EventProviderThreads associated to this module

      • enableAction

        public void enableAction(Action action)
        Retrieves and loads the JarvisAction defined by the provided Action.

        This method loads the corresponding JarvisAction based on jarvis' naming convention. The JarvisAction must be located under the action sub-package of the JarvisModule concrete subclass package.

        Parameters:
        action - the Action definition representing the JarvisAction to enable
        See Also:
        Loader.loadClass(String, Class)

      • disableAction

        public void disableAction(Action action)
        Disables the JarvisAction defined by the provided Action.
        Parameters:
        action - the Action definition representing the JarvisAction to disable

      • disableAllActions

        public final void disableAllActions()
        Disables all the JarvisActions of the JarvisModule.

      • getActions

        public final Collection<Class<? extends JarvisAction>> getActions()
        Returns all the JarvisAction Classes associated to this JarvisModule.

        This method returns the Classes describing the JarvisActions associated to this module. To construct a new JarvisAction from a EventInstance see createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession) .

        Returns:
        all the JarvisAction Classes associated to this JarvisModule
        See Also:
        createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession)

      • createJarvisAction

        public JarvisAction createJarvisAction(ActionInstance actionInstance,
                                       JarvisSession session)
        Creates a new JarvisAction instance from the provided ActionInstance.

        This methods attempts to construct a JarvisAction defined by the provided actionInstance by matching the eventInstance variables to the Action's parameters, and reusing the provided ActionInstance.getValues().

        Parameters:
        actionInstance - the ActionInstance representing the JarvisAction to create
        session - the JarvisSession associated to the action
        Returns:
        a new JarvisAction instance from the provided ActionInstance
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided actionInstance or session is null
        JarvisException - if the provided ActionInstance does not match any JarvisAction, or if an error occurred when building the JarvisAction
        See Also:
        getParameterValues(ActionInstance, JarvisContext)

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the JarvisModule.

        This method attempts to terminate all the running EventProvider threads, close the corresponding EventProviders, and disables all the module's actions.

        See Also:
        EventProvider.close(), disableAllActions()
